001.comments: It is recommended that you complete FNIS 100 prior to taking FNIS 220. Credits will be granted for only one of FNSP 200 or FNSP 220. This course is intended for undergraduate students only. If you are a graduate student, please visit: http://fnis.arts.ubc.ca/graduate-courses/. If the course is full, contact cis.program@ubc.ca to be added to the waitlist.

WL1.comments: This is a waitlist section for undergraduate students  - only register in this section if FNIS 220 001 is full. Registering in the waitlist section does not guarantee you a spot in the course. When spots open up you will be moved from this section to the actual course. Email cis.program@ubc.ca with any questions.

description: Representation, identity, and cultural politics through Indigenous literature, film, and the visual arts; the relationship between these sites of cultural production and the self-determination struggles of Indigenous peoples. Credit will be granted for only one of FNSP 200, FNIS 220, or FNSP 220.
